lines:
1956

hay 23,

ur. Shin C. luk,

Tang Shan,

China.

láy dear är. Luk:

Your letter of April 27th addressed

to ir. Stearns enclosing a urait for $300. has been

received, and referred to me in his absence. I am

sorry to tell you that he recently received a

message from London that Ers, Stearns was seriously

ins, and he was obliged to leave his school duties

and go to her.

I know that he will be very glad to

hear from you, and to learn that you are improving 
in your health. The spring term is well under way,

and everybody seems happy to have fine weather. The

prosnacts for good track and baseball teams are very

bright, and we are hoping to defeat Exeter later on.

With best wishes and kind regards, I

am

Very sincerely yours,

metadata.abstract: Letter stating that Luk's letter of April 27th and the $300 draft has been received. Mr. Stearns was unable to write since he is with Mrs. Stearns who is ill in London. Notes that the spring term is well underway.
